meanings.definition: To surpass in guile or cunning.
meanings.sent1: The clever fox managed to outfox the hunter and escape into the woods.
meanings.sent2: She was able to outfox her opponents in the chess tournament with her strategic moves.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried to outfox the zookeeper by pretending to be asleep during feeding time.
meanings.sent4: In the game of wits, she always found a way to outfox her challengers and emerge victorious.
meanings.sent5: The sly magician used his tricks to outfox the audience and leave them in awe.

meanings.sent1: The detective had to outfox the criminal in order to solve the case.
meanings.sent2: He managed to outfox his competitors by coming up with a unique marketing strategy.
meanings.sent3: The clever cat tried to outfox the laser pointer by anticipating its movements.
meanings.sent4: She had to outfox her fear of heights in order to climb the tall mountain.
meanings.sent5: The young inventor had to outfox the technical difficulties to complete his project on time.
